charges.charge_disposition: The defendant is hereby committed to the custody of the United States Attorney General or her duly authorized representative to be imprisoned for a term of 54 months. Upon release from custody, the defendant will be on supervised release for a term o f 5 years with the following special conditions: (1) within 72 hours of release from the custody of the Bureau of Prisons, the defendant will report in person to the United States Probation Office in the district to which the defendant is released; ( 2) the defendant will maintain total abstinence from the use of drugs and alcohol; (3) the defendant will participate in a program of substance abuse counseling, monitoring and drugs and alcohol; (3) the defendant will participate in a program of sub stance abuse counseling, monitoring, and treatment as deemed necessary by the United States Probation Office; and (4) the defendant is prohibited from associating with members of the Jungle Boys or any other street gang. The court recommends to the B ureau of Prisons that the defendant be designated to an Intensive Confinement Center at the earliest opportunity and that the defendant serve his sentence at the Federal Prison Camp at FCI Fairton, in Fairton, New Jersey; the Federal Prison Camp at F CI McKean in Bradford, Pennsylvania, or the Federal Prison Camp at FCI Schuylkill in Minersville, Pennsylvania. The defendant will voluntarily surrender to the U.S. Marshal for this district at such time and place as designated by the Bureau of Priso ns. Counts two, seven, and nine are dismissed on the oral motion of the United States. It is ordered that the defendant will pay a Special Assessment of $50.00, for count one which will be due immediately. 2/3/98 Amended Judgment: Special condit ion of supervised release the defendant will pay all, or a portion of, the costs associated with treatment based on his ability to pay, in an amount to be determined by the United States Probation Officer.

charges.charge_disposition: The defendant is hereby committed to the custody of the United States Attorney General or her duly authorized representative to be imprisoned for a term of 120 months. Upon release from custody, the defendant will be on supervised release for a term of 10 years with the following special conditions: (1) the defendant will participate in a program of substance abuse counseling, monitoring, and treatment as deemed necessary by the United States Probation Office; and (2) the defendant will not asso ciate with gang memebers. The court recommends to the Bureau of Prisons that the defendant be considered for placement at the Bureau of Prisons facility at Raybrook or if that placement is not possible, at another Bureau of Prisons facility that will allow him to pursue his interest s in furthering his education and vocational training; and that the defendant be considered for participation in the bootcamp program if and when he comes eligible. Count 10 is dismissed on the oral motion of the Uni ted States. It is ordered that the defendant will pay a special assessment of $50.00, for count one which will be due immediately.
